alfredsnippet.snippet:
http://www.imca.cc/mars/martian-meteorites.htm

"In the late 1970s scientists came to realize that three odd groups of achondrites known at that time (three shergottites, three nakhlites and a unique stone called Chassigny) might be genetically related, and a few scientists (notably Lewis Ashwal and Edward Stolper) even dared to hypothesize that all of these may come from Mars ..."

(cont'd)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Martian Meteorites Do Not All Exhibit the Same Oxygen Isotope Ratio - Part 1
